body:
### Describe your issue

Hello. Working from the HEAD on the main branch of https://github.com/MatthewRalston/kmerdb

Relevant files are `kmerdb/cublas_gemm` and `kmerdb/regression.pyx`.

Could use some help. I'm not able to access cublas functionality. Errors galore and it was some scaffolding I took from ChatGPT.


# Issue Type

Cythonization issues with cublas extension and gemm multiplication. Issues consist of type issues, related to casting double-precsision to Python objects. Unclear to me. Pasting below.

```
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:71:15: Cannot convert 'double **' to Python object
      
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
          cdef double *d_B
          cdef double *d_C
      
          # Allocate device memory
          cudaMalloc(&d_A, m * k * sizeof(double))
          cudaMalloc(&d_B, k * n * sizeof(double))
                     ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:72:15: Cannot convert 'double **' to Python object
      
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
          cdef double *d_C
      
          # Allocate device memory
          cudaMalloc(&d_A, m * k * sizeof(double))
          cudaMalloc(&d_B, k * n * sizeof(double))
          cudaMalloc(&d_C, m * n * sizeof(double))
                     ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:73:15: Cannot convert 'double **' to Python object
      
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
      
          for i in range(k * n):
              h_B[i] = <double> B[i // B.shape[1], i % B.shape[1]]  # Convert to double
      
          # Copy from host arrays to device
          cudaMemcpy(d_A, int(h_A), m * k * sizeof(double), cudaMemcpyHostToDevice)
                              ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:87:24: Cannot convert 'double *' to Python object

     ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:87:15: Cannot convert 'double *' to Python object
      
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
          for i in range(k * n):
              h_B[i] = <double> B[i // B.shape[1], i % B.shape[1]]  # Convert to double
      
          # Copy from host arrays to device
          cudaMemcpy(d_A, int(h_A), m * k * sizeof(double), cudaMemcpyHostToDevice)
          cudaMemcpy(d_B, int(h_B), k * n * sizeof(double), cudaMemcpyHostToDevice)
                              ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:88:24: Cannot convert 'double *' to Python object
      
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
          for i in range(k * n):
              h_B[i] = <double> B[i // B.shape[1], i % B.shape[1]]  # Convert to double
      
          # Copy from host arrays to device
          cudaMemcpy(d_A, int(h_A), m * k * sizeof(double), cudaMemcpyHostToDevice)
          cudaMemcpy(d_B, int(h_B), k * n * sizeof(double), cudaMemcpyHostToDevice)
                     ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------


```

# Other issues

## Missing Memcpy.pxd file

The default paths searched for the Cython memcpy header is missing. Using pipenv for virtualenv management. Source installed 3.12.4 C-Python otherwise.


```
  error: subprocess-exited-with-error
  
  × Getting requirements to build wheel did not run successfully.
  │ exit code: 1
  ╰─> [154 lines of output]
      /mnt/tmp/pip-build-env-gd_ak7r8/overlay/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Compiler/Main.py:381: FutureWarning: Cython directive 'language_level' not set, using '3str' for now (Py3). This has changed from earlier releases! File: /develop/repos/kdb/kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx
        tree = Parsing.p_module(s, pxd, full_module_name)
      
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
      '''
      # cublas_gemm.pyx
      import numpy as np
      cimport numpy as cnp
      from libc.stdlib cimport malloc, free
      from libc.stdlib cimport memcpy
      ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:22:0: 'libc/stdlib/memcpy.pxd' not found

```


## Missing CudaMemcpyHostToDevice

Additional missing cuda commands from ?? Not sure, new Cython programmer.


```
      Error compiling Cython file:
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      ...
      
          for i in range(k * n):
              h_B[i] = <double> B[i // B.shape[1], i % B.shape[1]]  # Convert to double
      
          # Copy from host arrays to device
          cudaMemcpy(d_A, int(h_A), m * k * sizeof(double), cudaMemcpyHostToDevice)
                                                            ^
      ------------------------------------------------------------
      
      kmerdb/cublas_gemm.pyx:87:54: undeclared name not builtin: cudaMemcpyHostToDevice


```

comment_data.body: This does not look like a Cython bug or feature request to me. Please ask on the cython-users mailing list if you want help with using Cython from a broader audience.
The only thing I'd have added before closing this issue is: `memcpy` is in `libc.string`. This is because it's in the `<string.h>` header of the C standard library.

title: how do i address a missing "memcpy" pxd file when cythonizing my extension
